fact_check_explanation_title: The asylum backlog is far higher now than when Labour left government
fact_check_explanation_summary: The home secretary told Parliament the current backlog bears “no comparison” to the situation in 2010, and that Labour would be “found wanting” in any comparison.

fact_check_explanation_title: Hundreds of people have been prosecuted for tax evasion in the last two years
fact_check_explanation_summary: A much lower figure tweeted by a Labour MP only included prosecutions for enabling tax evasion.

fact_check_explanation_title: Hoax posts about ‘missing uncle’ Martin Jones shared widely online
fact_check_explanation_summary: Hundreds of people have shared fake alerts about a missing pensioner with dementia.

fact_check_explanation_title: The UK doesn’t have more job vacancies than unemployed people
fact_check_explanation_summary: A column by former work and pensions secretary Chloe Smith was corrected after we contacted the MP about the error.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence to support Rishi Sunak’s asylum backlog claim
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Prime Minister said there were 6,000 fewer people in the “asylum backlog”—but the latest published figures show a large rise in the number of people waiting for applications to …

fact_check_explanation_title: Post about injured dog found on ‘side road’ in Northern Ireland is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: The picture of the dog was actually taken from a 2020 news article about an incident in Pembrokeshire.

fact_check_explanation_title: ‘Illegal immigrants’ are not entitled to more benefits than pensioners
fact_check_explanation_summary: False information comparing benefits and other financial support has been circulating for more than a decade.

fact_check_explanation_title: Who are the 100 million displaced people Suella Braverman said could qualify for UK protection?
fact_check_explanation_summary: We’ve looked into the figures after the Home Secretary claimed 100 million people could be eligible for protection under current UK laws.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post about dog ‘injured in a hit-and-run’ is a hoax
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post about an injured dog found in south-east London is a hoax. It uses a photo from a hit-and-run incident in New Jersey in 2020.

fact_check_explanation_title: Agenda 2030 will not enforce eating insects, banning cars or a global dictatorship
fact_check_explanation_summary: A cartoon on Facebook implies that Agenda 2030 will create a UN/WHO dictatorship and introduce several global policies.

fact_check_explanation_title: There is no free ‘mystery bus’ in Brussels
fact_check_explanation_summary: A viral Twitter joke about a bus supposedly called ‘not the 48’ is being taken seriously by some.

fact_check_explanation_title: Asylum seekers do not receive £175 a week
fact_check_explanation_summary: Payments are significantly lower and reduced further if meals are provided.
